content:
That sounds fascinating! Coiling and scoring are both wonderful techniques to create unique textures and patterns on ceramics. The coiling process allows for a more organic, handmade feel, while scoring can add a level of precision and visual interest.

I can imagine that the combination of these techniques is creating a truly one-of-a-kind vase. The texture must be really intriguing, with the coils providing a sense of movement and the scoring adding a level of depth and visual tension.

Are you planning to add any glazes or surface treatments to enhance the texture and visual appeal of the vase, or are you going to leave it more natural to showcase the tactile quality of the clay?

Also, have you considered what kind of inspiration or theme you'd like to convey with this vase? For example, is it more abstract, or does it draw from nature, architecture, or another source?
